To centralise the nose leg assembly during an up selection.

the rate of descent is too high.

to ensure the aircraft is still rolling.

Questions.QuestionString: A fusible plug fitted to an aircraft wheel prevents. (Level 3)

Questions.QuestionString: In the case of pressurized aircraft, the nose-wheel bay. (Level 3)

8.6 times the root square of the tyre pressure in psi.

Questions.QuestionString: Tubed tyres are stored. (Level 3)
Answers: horizontally, up to 4 in total staggering them to prevent distortion of beads.
horizontally, up to 4 in total in a rack with supporting tubes so each tyre is supported at 2 points.

Questions.QuestionString: When inflating a tyre and you notice ice in the valve stem. (Level 3)

wait for ice to melt before carrying on with inflation.
